title: Ticket #7074: Enable SSL authentication by default
description:
Similar to #7070 for TOKENs, we should enable SSL by default. TODO list:

  1. Have sane defaults for the server cert and key location. This is /etc/pki/tls/certs/localhost.crt and /etc/pki/tls/private/localhost.key, respectively, on RHEL.
    • This page suggests that the correct locations are /etc/ssl/certs/server.crt and /etc/ssl/private/server.key, respectively, for Debian
  2. Use system trust anchors by default. I believe this can be handled by default by OpenSSL (needs investigation).
  3. Enable SSL by default if there is a file where the host cert and key are expected. Similar to TOKEN, this should only be tried once per reconfig to avoid repeated queries of the filesystem.
